body: This sounds good to me. If anyone has time to tackle this and send a PR, that would be definitely appreciated.
I'll send a PR in next days/weeks.

issue.title: Can ignore arguments that cause redefined-outer-name

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
Just like unused-argument, redefined-outer-name now also uses ignored-argument-names.

Technically this is a new feature but it should be easy to backport to 1.8 anyway.

### Fixes / new features
- Fixes #1535

issue.title: Update Pylint config

repository.name: coretools
repository.description: Core python tools for building and using IOTile based devices

issue.body:
## Overview & Major Changes
- Updates the pylint config to match the template used by newer pylint versions (to ease diffing with default config, for example);
- Prepares the pylint config of coretools to be used as global default for all Arch projects.
Related issue: https://github.com/iotile/archfx_cloud/issues/251
Related PR: https://github.com/iotile/archfx_cloud/pull/373
(No need to read through all discussion there, but may provide some context.)

### Additional Notes
In case total PR would be confusing (since sections moved around, many style changes), individual commits show atomic, readable changes.
All commits until `2cdf9bd`: only style updates.
`3378d64` to `9972322`: new (from newer pylint versions) defaults.
`c4505db` onwards: non-default changes, each one explained in commit message.
Can be squashed after review if that's the preferred approach.

#### Unsolved challenge
Since subprojects inside this repo are not Python packages, the `.pylintrc` is not automatically applied when current directory is not top-level.
Example:
`$ pylint iotilecore/iotile/core/utilities/async_tools`
PWD is `<coretools>` (project root). This command will use the top-level `.pylintrc`.
`$ pylint async_tools`
PWD is `<coretools>/iotilecore/iotile/core/utilities`. This command will NOT use the top-level `.pylintrc`, because Pylint looks for an rcfile in parent directories only as long as each of them is a package. `iotilecore` directory is not a package (has no `__init__.py`) and search stops there, at which point Pylint defaults to a built-in config.

Ways to deal with it:
1. Specify rcfile directly (either via `--rcfile` argument or via `PYLINTRC` env variable). Somewhat cumbersome. If using an editor with Pylint support, depends on editor's ability to run different command/set of env variables per project;
2. Add a symlink to the main rcfile to each subproject. Will work fine, but depends on contributor's OS/FS to support symlinks. Windows with NTFS should be able to handle it, OS X/Linux with most filesystems, obviously, too;
3. Add an `__init__.py` file to each subproject. Will work fine, should be OS/FS-independent. Seems like a best approach to me, but maybe breaks some Python packaging (`setup.py`/`setup.cfg`) logic?
4. Pylint should soon add an `rcfile` option to the pylintrc. This will allow to 'include' other rcfiles, and so we could have a `.pylintrc` in each subproject that would have a single `rcfile=../.pylintrc` line in it. Depends on Pylint upstream and on contributors using the newest Pylint version, though.

Should I go for 2 or 3, or do we proceed with 1 with no further changes?

body: I'm not working anymore on this project so I can't tell you if it's fine but thank you !

issue.title: False Positive W0621: Redefining name %r from outer scope when using pytest fixtures

labels.name: Lib specific ðŸ’…
labels.description: This affect the code from a particular library

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
### Bug description

Bug opened from [SO issue](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46089480/pytest-fixtures-redefining-name-from-outer-scope-pylint)

Testcase:


```
# test_wallet.py

@pytest.fixture
def my_wallet():
    '''Returns a Wallet instance with a zero balance'''
    return Wallet()

@pytest.mark.parametrize("earned,spent,expected", [
    (30, 10, 20),
    (20, 2, 18),
])
def test_transactions(my_wallet, earned, spent, expected):
    my_wallet.add_cash(earned)
    my_wallet.spend_cash(spent)
    assert my_wallet.balance == expected
```

They discuss a workaround to avoid the error and also a method of disabling the checker but this bug issue is about actually fixing it in Pylint, or at least discussing it.

### Configuration

_No response_


### Pylint output

```shell
`W0621: Redefining name %r from outer scope (line %s)'`
```


### Expected behavior

The Pylint message should recognize this situation of pytest fixture decorator and don't raise a message.

### Pylint version

```shell
pylint 2.8.4
astroid 2.5.8
Python 3.7.5
```

### OS / Environment

Windows

### Additional dependencies

_No response_

issue.title: STYLE rename fixtures and enable redefined-outer-name on tests

repository.name: pandas
repository.description: Flexible and powerful data analysis / manipulation library for Python, providing labeled data structures similar to R data.frame objects, statistical functions, and much more

issue.body:
What's blocking this check

https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/45bd6372f24edccf68c2a5d05224295e805bde80/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L84-L98

from being enabled on test files is that it gets thrown off by fixtures

The solution is to use `name=`:

https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/1535#issuecomment-708172651

I'll write a script to auto-fix this, just opening the issue as a placeholder. Names shadowing other names can hide bugs so I'm pretty keen to put in the effort to automate checking this

Note that this is what the pytest docs recommend doing https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/reference/reference.html#pytest-fixture :

> If a fixture is used in the same module in which it is defined, the function name of the fixture will be shadowed by the function arg that requests the fixture; one way to resolve this is to name the decorated function fixture_<fixturename> and then use @pytest.fixture(name='<fixturename>').

issue.title: False negative ``redefined-outer-name`` when an import aliased to ``_`` is redefined in a function

labels.name: False Negative ðŸ¦‹
labels.description: No message is emitted but something is wrong with the code

labels.name: Needs PR
labels.description: This issue is accepted, sufficiently specified and now needs an implementation

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
### Bug description
```python
#/usr/bin/env python

import math as _


class MyClass:
    def mymeth(self):
        _ = 123
        print(_.abs(-123))
```

Notice that  the sample Python redefines the global `_` inside the method. This should throw a [W0621](https://pylint.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user_guide/messages/warning/redefined-outer-name.html) error, but does not.


### Command used

```shell
pylint test.py
```


### Pylint output

```shell
    ************* Module test
    test.py:1:0: C0114: Missing module docstring (missing-module-docstring)
    test.py:3:0: C0115: Missing class docstring (missing-class-docstring)
    test.py:4:4: C0116: Missing function or method docstring (missing-function-docstring)
    test.py:6:14: E1101: Instance of 'int' has no 'abs' member (no-member)
    test.py:3:0: R0903: Too few public methods (1/2) (too-few-public-methods)
```


### Expected behavior

W0621 should be enforced.

### Pylint version

```shell
2.17.5
```


### OS / Environment

Ubuntu 20
